Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; glaze fired red-brown; interior of bowl and exterior of foot slipped white, then glazed; two added white bands around bottom of foot; reserved edge of foot; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888, 0601.363. For parallels regarding the shape of the foot, see Lemos no. 1071 from Marion.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 759, pl. XXI, no. 759)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 410)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1058) (phase 2)
